text: Ronald Frederick Atkinson (born 18 March 1939), commonly known as Big Ron, is an English former football player and manager. In the 1990s and early 2000s, he was one of Britain's best-known football pundits. He spent his playing career at Oxford United. As a manager, he won the FA Cup with Manchester United in 1983 and 1985 and the Football League Cup with Sheffield Wednesday in 1991 and Aston Villa in 1994. ==Managerial statistics== Managerial record by team and tenure Team From To Record Record Record Record Record Team From To Kettering Town 14 December 1971 22 November 1974 Cambridge United 22 November 1974 12 January 1978 West Bromwich Albion 12 January 1978 9 June 1981 Manchester United 9 June 1981 6 November 1986 West Bromwich Albion 3 September 1987 12 October 1988 Atlético Madrid 12 October 1988 16 January 1989 Sheffield Wednesday 14 February 1989 6 June 1991 Aston Villa 7 June 1991 10 November 1994 Coventry City 15 February 1995 5 November 1996 Sheffield Wednesday 14 November 1997 17 May 1998 Nottingham Forest 11 January 1999 16 May 1999 Total Total Total ==Honours== ===Manager=== Kettering Town *Southern League Premier Division: 1972–73Ron Atkinson LMA.
